case_vignette: An otherwise healthy 45-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 1-year history of episodic abdominal cramps, bloating, and flatulence. The symptoms worsen when she has pizza or ice cream and have become more frequent over the past 4 months. Lactose intolerance is suspected.
question: Which  findings would most strongly support the diagnosis of lactose intolerance?
correct_ans: tall villi with focal collections of goblet cells
